definitions: large building used for storing and maintaining aircraft
examples: The private jet was parked in the airport hangar
Mechanics worked on planes inside the spacious hangar

definitions: shaped frame with hook for hanging clothes
examples: She placed her coat on a wooden hanger
The closet needed more hangers for all the clothes

definitions: execution by suspending person from rope around neck
decorative piece of fabric or art hung on wall
examples: Public hangings were common in the Old West
The judge sentenced the criminal to death by hanging
The tapestry hanging added warmth to the room
She bought a macrame hanging for the bedroom

definitions: person who carries out executions by hanging
game where players guess letters to complete word
examples: The hangman prepared the gallows for the execution
Being a hangman was considered an unpleasant profession
The children played hangman during the car ride
She drew the hangman's noose on the board

definitions: place where people regularly meet to relax and socialize
examples: The coffee shop became their favorite hangout spot
Teenagers need safe hangouts after school

definitions: unpleasant physical effects following excessive alcohol consumption
examples: He woke up with a terrible hangover after the party
Coffee and water help ease hangover symptoms

definitions: coil or loop of rope, yarn, or hair
examples: She bought a hank of wool for her knitting project
The sailor coiled the rope into neat hanks

definitions: informal term for handkerchief used to wipe nose
examples: He pulled out his hankey to blow his nose
The child needed a hankey for her runny nose

definitions: monkey deity in Hinduism devoted to Rama
examples: Devotees prayed at the Hanuman temple every Tuesday
The statue of Hanuman stood guard at the entrance

definitions: event or occurrence, especially one that is noteworthy
examples: The festival was the biggest happening of the summer
Strange happenings occurred in the old house

definitions: person or thing that announces or signals the approach of something
examples: Robins are harbingers of spring in many regions
Dark clouds were harbingers of the approaching storm

definitions: sheltered part of sea or lake where ships can anchor safely
examples: Fishing boats returned to the harbour before sunset
The natural harbour protected ships from storms

definitions: book bound with rigid protective covers
examples: The hardback edition costs more than the paperback
She preferred hardback books for her library

definitions: aggressive and uncompromising methods in politics or business
baseball played with a hard ball
examples: The union decided to play hardball during negotiations
Politicians played hardball to pass the legislation
Kids practiced hardball at the local diamond
Hardball requires protective equipment for safety

definitions: book with stiff protective covers made of cardboard
examples: The hardcover version featured beautiful illustrations
Libraries prefer hardcover books for durability

definitions: process of becoming hard or making something hard
examples: The hardening of concrete takes several days
Arteries showed signs of hardening with age

definitions: severe suffering or privation causing difficulty in life
examples: The family endured financial hardship during the recession
War refugees faced incredible hardship

definitions: car with fixed rigid roof rather than convertible top
examples: He chose the hardtop version over the convertible
The hardtop provided better security and insulation

definitions: wood from deciduous trees used for furniture and flooring
examples: The dining table was made from solid hardwood
Hardwood floors increase a home's value

definitions: fast-running mammal similar to rabbit with longer ears and legs
examples: The hare bounded across the meadow at dawn
Hares can run much faster than rabbits

definitions: separate part of household reserved for wives and concubines in some cultures
examples: The sultan's harem was guarded by eunuchs
Ottoman harems were complex social institutions

definitions: mute comic character in colorful diamond-patterned costume
pattern of diamond shapes in contrasting colors
examples: The harlequin entertained crowds with silent comedy
Traditional harlequin costumes feature bright diamonds
She wore tights with a harlequin pattern
The floor had a black and white harlequin design

definitions: archaic or literary term for prostitute
examples: Biblical texts often mention harlots in ancient cities
The novel portrayed the life of Victorian harlots

definitions: overtone accompanying fundamental tone at fixed intervals
examples: The violin produced beautiful harmonics
Musicians study harmonic theory in composition

definitions: small rectangular wind instrument played with mouth
examples: He played blues tunes on his harmonica
The harmonica fit easily in his pocket

definitions: process of making things compatible or consistent with each other
examples: Tax harmonisation across Europe proved challenging
The harmonisation of standards improved trade

definitions: keyboard instrument producing sound by air through reeds
examples: The church harmonium accompanied hymn singing
She practiced scales on the old harmonium

definitions: process of making different things work together in agreement
examples: Harmonization of regulations facilitated international trade
The choir worked on harmonization of their voices

definitions: combination of simultaneously sounded musical notes producing pleasing effect
state of peaceful agreement and cooperation
examples: The singers achieved perfect harmony in the chorus
Jazz musicians explored complex harmonies
The community lived in harmony for generations
They sought harmony between tradition and progress

definitions: large triangular stringed instrument played with fingers
examples: The orchestra's harp added ethereal beauty to the music
She practiced harp for hours each day

definitions: person who plays the harp professionally
examples: The medieval harper entertained the royal court
Professional harpers are rare musicians today

definitions: person who plays the harp, especially professionally
examples: The principal harpist tuned her instrument before the concert
Wedding harpists create romantic atmosphere

definitions: barbed spear used for hunting whales and large fish
examples: Whalers threw harpoons from the ship's bow
The museum displayed ancient Inuit harpoons

definitions: keyboard instrument with strings plucked by quills
examples: Bach composed many pieces for harpsichord
The harpsichord preceded the modern piano

definitions: mythological creature with woman's head and bird's body
bad-tempered or grasping woman
examples: Greek myths described harpies as wind spirits
The harpies tormented sailors in the story
His mother-in-law was a real harpy
The gossip columnist was called a harpy

definitions: medium-sized dog breed used for hunting hares
slender hawk that hunts by flying low
examples: The pack of harriers chased the hare
Harriers make excellent hunting companions
The marsh harrier glided over the wetlands
Harriers hunt small mammals and birds

definitions: agricultural implement with spikes for breaking up soil
examples: The farmer pulled the harrow behind his tractor
Spring harrowing prepared fields for planting

definitions: process or period of gathering crops when ripe
examples: The wheat harvest began in late summer
Farmers celebrated after a successful harvest

definitions: machine for harvesting crops from fields
person who gathers crops during harvest
examples: The combine harvester moved through wheat fields
Modern harvesters increased farm efficiency
Migrant harvesters arrived for apple season
Harvesters worked from dawn to dusk

definitions: act or process of gathering mature crops from fields
examples: Harvesting continued despite threatening weather
Mechanical harvesting revolutionized agriculture

definitions: dish of chopped meat and vegetables fried together
symbol (#) used in social media and computing
examples: The diner served corned beef hash for breakfast
She made hash from leftover roast beef
Add a hash before keywords on social media
The hash symbol indicates a number

definitions: resinous extract of cannabis plant used as drug
examples: Hashish use dates back centuries in some cultures
Police seized blocks of hashish at the border

definitions: word or phrase preceded by # used on social media to identify topics
examples: The hashtag went viral within hours
She added relevant hashtags to increase visibility

definitions: irritating inconvenience or problem causing trouble
examples: Parking downtown is always such a hassle
They avoided the hassle of cooking by ordering takeout

definitions: excessive speed or urgency of movement or action
examples: In his haste, he forgot important documents
Haste makes waste, as the saying goes
